description:
Spice is a statically-typed, easy to use and compiled programming language. It supports cross-compilation and is especially useful for programming close to the system.

The Spice Programming Language is a compiled language, which can score with it's blazing fast execution time and the universal applicability.
Spice is inspired partially by Golang and C, but improves some things by abstraction which could impact ones productivity in a negative way.
Changelog
- 1a67f84: Increase coverage (#944) (@marcauberer)
- 08c23e2: Fix sanitizer testing bug (#945) (@marcauberer)
- 5027853: Refactor drivers (#946) (@marcauberer)
- a7b9579: Rework test runner (#947) (@marcauberer)
- 1f6e5e9: Support latest Ubuntu/Debian releases and deprecated the deprecated ones (#948) (@marcauberer)
- d6a87a2: Use version variables in CI workflows (#949) (@marcauberer)
- 3699484: Add more tests for unsafe (#950) (@marcauberer)
- 6956bb4: Add operator combinations test (#951) (@marcauberer)
- c22bae0: Upgrade to LLVM 21.1.6 (#952) (@marcauberer)
- 727be0a: Introduce SaveAndRestore RAII helper (#953) (@marcauberer)
- aaa4e9d: Remove headers from CMake targets (#954) (@marcauberer)
- 5554dbe: Bump actions/checkout from 5 to 6 in /.github/workflows (#955) (@dependabot[bot])
- 1a3d9e4: Fix typo in publish workflow (@marcauberer)
What to do next?
- Install Spice
- Visit www.spicelang.com to test the new features
